result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is to commence immediately and is to be concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be arround any known drug users or dealers
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

10:51 AM Ashley M Chavez appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew J. Christenson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Defendant does not request counsel. Court goes over reason for the hearing today. Futher statement by the Court - goes over letter received regarding the defendant's conduct. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant. Statement by the Court - rescinds the ruling and denies the request for sentence adjustment at this time.

Court adjourned at 10:58 a.m.
Hearing on April 19, 2021 at 10:45 am. / Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Taycheedah Correctional)
Rescinding the Order granting the Motion for Sentence Modification
Letter to Judge Slate from Sara Martinez (DOC) dated 04/09/2021 re: major conduct report & 30 days of disciplinary separation
(on State's Motion to Reconsider)

1:35 PM Ashley M Chavez appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew J. Christenson as special prosecutor appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Agent Ryan Helmuth appears via video. Defendant  has no objection to holding this hearing via video. Defendant requests to proceed without counsel. Court scheduled this hearing due to the State filing a motion for reconsideration on the petition for sentence adjustment. Atty Christenson is still objecting. Statement by the Court. Statement by Atty Christenson - requests the petition be denied and states reasons. Statement by defendant. Statement by Kevin Chavez. Court issues ruling - grants the sentence adjustment and the remaining time will be converted to Extended Supervision.

Court adjourned at 1:44 p.m.
Motion hearing on April 8, 2021 at 01:00 pm. /  Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (emailed to Social Services @Taycheedah Correctional)

records.addlTxt:
9:13 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Timothy Hogan.  Peter Hahn as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hogan has received a copy of the presentence investigation report and the alternative presentence investigation report, lists the corrections, with no additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report and the alternative presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Cody A. Wells.  Statement by Bob Dore.  Sentencing statement by Atty Hahn.  Sentencing statement by Atty Christenson on 2013CM218.  Sentencing statement by Atty Hogan.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2013CM218

1 year of Initial Confinement and 1 year of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is serving.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SYPERVISION:

-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be arround any known drug users or dealers
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

2014CF32

8 years of Initial Confinement and 8 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be arround any known drug users or dealers
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-75 hours of community service

Court finds the defendant not eligible for CIP and not eligible for SAR.

Court grants the defendant 535 days of sentence credit.

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 9:58 a.m.
ALTERNATIVE PSI
Sentencing hearing at 09-21-2015 09:00 am

from Atty Bret Grant - requests an extension to file the PSI.  PSI is to be filed on or before June 17, 2015
Sentencing hearing at 07-07-2015 10:00 am

10:02 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Tim Hogan.  Kyle Sargent as special Prosecutor via telephone on 2014CF32.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin on 2013CM218.  Atty Hogan recites plea agreement - defendant will plea to each of the charges in each of the cases.  Atty Sargent concurs.  Atty Vanden Branden concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on each count on each of the cases.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a PSI be filed within 60 days an dsentencing to be scheduled in 90 days.  Court sets for sentencing on July 7, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:10 a.m.
Plea hearing at 04-07-2015 10:00 am
Status hearing on April 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Argument by Special Prosecutor Sargent - requests motion be denied.  Court denies the request for bond modification.  Court questions counsel regarding next appearance.  Court will set for status hearing.

Court adjourned at 11:14 a.m.

11:07 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Attorney Haase indicates the defendant is waiving her right to a preliminary hearing - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Attorney Haase enters a plea NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs a Status Heairng to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court grants defense counsel ten days to file any request for substitution of judge.

Court adjourned at 11:10 a.m.
By Atty Jeffrey Haase

2:59 p.m.  State by DA Kyle Sargent.  Defendant present, in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, and with Attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Attorney Mitchell confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court states probable cause has been found.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  

Court orders bond set at $2500.00  cash bond with the conditions of:  NO contact with Tony L. or Julian S.    Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess/consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Not to leave the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Mitchell indicates the time limits will not be waived as to the preliminary hearing.  Court will schedule for next week.

Court adjourned at 3:07 p.m.
